name: Honey Mustard Avocado (Crockpot)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the honey mustard profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the avocado, coat well, cover, and marinate 1–8 hours (overnight okay) in the refrigerator.
Transfer the avocado (and any marinade) to the slow cooker with 1/2 cup broth or water.
Cook on LOW 4–6 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Shred or slice as appropriate and fold back into juices.
Garnish: Finish with cilantro before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Teriyaki Avocado (Air Fryer)
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 380–390°F.
Place the avocado in a single layer in the basket.
Air fry 25 minutes, flipping halfway, until cooked through and edges are crisp.
Garnish: Finish with cilantro before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Teriyaki Avocado (No Cook)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the avocado with the flavorings and a drizzle of olive oil.
Fold in chopped vegetables or herbs as desired.
Chill 10–15 minutes to let flavors meld; serve.
Garnish: Finish with cilantro before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Tomato Basil Avocado (Crockpot)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the tomato basil profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the avocado, coat well, cover, and marinate 1–8 hours (overnight okay) in the refrigerator.
Transfer the avocado (and any marinade) to the slow cooker with 1/2 cup broth or water.

Garnish: Finish with cilantro before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Garlic Herb Bacon (Instant Pot)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the garlic herb profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the bacon, coat well, cover, and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator.
Set Instant Pot to Sauté and warm a little oil.
Sear the bacon briefly on both sides; cancel Sauté.
Add 1/2–3/4 cup broth or sauce. Seal and Pressure Cook 12 minutes. Natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.
Garnish: Finish with chives before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Honey Mustard Bacon (Instant Pot)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the honey mustard profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the bacon, coat well, cover, and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator.

notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment or foil.
Arrange the duck breast on the pan (shake off excess marinade if used).
Bake 22 minutes, flipping once if needed, until cooked through.
Garnish: Finish with orange zest or chives before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Teriyaki Duck Breast (Oven Bake)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the teriyaki profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the duck breast, coat well, cover, and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator.
Heat oven to 425°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment or foil.
Arrange the duck breast on the pan (shake off excess marinade if used).
Bake 15 minutes, flipping once if needed, until cooked through.
Garnish: Finish with orange zest or chives before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Tomato Basil Duck Breast (Instant Pot)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the tomato basil profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the duck breast, coat well, cover, and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator.
Set Instant Pot to Sauté and warm a little oil.
Sear the duck breast briefly on both sides; cancel Sauté.
Add 1/2–3/4 cup broth or sauce. Seal and Pressure Cook 12 minutes. Natural release 5 minutes, then quick release.
Garnish: Finish with orange zest or chives before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Honey Mustard Egg Salad (Grill)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the honey mustard profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the egg salad, coat well, cover, and marinate 30–60 minutes in the refrigerator.
Preheat grill to medium‑high (375–400°F). Clean and oil the grates.
Grill the egg salad 4–6 minutes per side (thicker pieces may need longer) until cooked through.
Rest 3–5 minutes before serving.
Garnish: Finish with chives before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Lemon Pepper Egg Salad (No Cook)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the egg salad with the flavorings and a drizzle of olive oil.
Fold in chopped vegetables or herbs as desired.
Chill 10–15 minutes to let flavors meld; serve.
Garnish: Finish with chives before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Teriyaki Egg Salad (No Cook)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the egg salad with the flavorings and a drizzle of olive oil.

notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Coconut Curry Eggplant (Crockpot)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the coconut curry profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the eggplant, coat well, cover, and marinate 1–8 hours (overnight okay) in the refrigerator.
Transfer the eggplant (and any marinade) to the slow cooker with 1/2 cup broth or water.
Cook on LOW 5–7 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
Shred or slice as appropriate and fold back into juices.
Garnish: Finish with basil before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Lemon Pepper Eggplant (Stove Top)
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium‑high heat.

Garnish: Finish with basil before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

Place the shrimp in a single layer in the basket.
Air fry 18 minutes, flipping halfway, until cooked through and edges are crisp.
Garnish: Finish with parsley before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Lemon Pepper Shrimp (Air Fryer)

name: Lemon Pepper Shrimp (Stove Top)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the lemon pepper profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the shrimp, coat well, cover, and marinate 15–30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium‑high heat.
Sear the shrimp 3–4 minutes per side until browned.
Reduce heat to medium and cook until done (about 22 minutes total).
Garnish: Finish with parsley before serving.
notes: Season to taste. Use a thermometer for doneness where applicable; rest meats before slicing.

name: Cajun Steak (Air Fryer)

name: Cajun Steak (Stove Top)

name: Teriyaki Steak (Crockpot)
instructions: Marinade: In a bowl, whisk the flavorings for the teriyaki profile with oil and a pinch of salt. Add the steak, coat well, cover, and marinate 2–12 hours in the refrigerator.
Transfer the steak (and any marinade) to the slow cooker with 1/2 cup broth or water.
Cook on LOW 6–8 hours (or HIGH half the time) until tender.
